author: Special Correspondent
text:
A special police team has cracked a nine-month-old murder case by arresting three persons who allegedly murdered a 58-year-old woman for gain after waylaying her on March 28 last year.

As the case, initially registered as suspicious death and then altered as murder for gain, could not be resolved for long, Superintendent of Police N. Manivannan formed a special team, which achieved arrested the accused on January 2, police also said.

Waylaid, murdered

Headed by Assistant Superintendent of Police S. Sarveshraj, the special team, comprising Inspector of Police Periasamy and Sub-Inspector of Police R. Jesudoss, found that the accused waylaid the woman at Kooriyur tank and murdered her for gain. The accused were consuming liquor, when they found the woman walking along the tank.

1.25 sovereigns

They tried to snatch her ear stud, thali and four gold coins, all weighing a meagre 1.25 sovereigns, the police said. As she raised an alarm, the accused strangulated her to death, using her sari and dumped the body at the tank. They were produced before a court on January 3 and remanded in judicial custody.
title: Special police team cracks murder case
